experience.description:
1. Product Management for Heineken Sales Core platform with 3500 end-users: Sales Force Automation, CRM, InvestMngt, AssetMngt, DistributionMngt.. (60% of work time) 
■ Main activities: 
– gathering and analysis of product metrics, business aims, feedback 
– road-map and backlog management 
– UX/UI design, prototyping 
– conducting role of PO in SCRUM ceremonies 
– scouting and piloting new perspective technologies 
■ Achievements: 
– first SCRUM project in the Russian OpCo 
– inplementing productive metrics for key solutions 
– proven ROI 165% (savings), with potential up to 2000% (new features value, and order losses reduction) 
 
2. Leading a Sales&Marketing Solutions support team. (30% of time) 
■ Main activities: 
– support processes setting up for 24 IT solutions 
– recruitment and coaching consultants for 2nd line support 
– finance and contracts management 
– collaboration with other teams: suppliers, Service Desk, server infrastructure, common services teams. 
■ Achievements: 
– increasing the reliability rate due to permanent problem management, predictive synthetic monitoring and alerting 
– as a result, shrinking an incident and how-to requests flow in 2..4 times for existing solutions 
– saving about $10 000 per month due to hosting and licensing optimization 
 
3. Participation in related Heineken's projects: Global Service Desk, e-Commerce platform, Agile transformation. (10%) 
– a member of Heineken's Product Management Guild. 
– a member of Heineken's Talents program and personnel reserve.

1. Best ITSM practices consulting (ITIL, CobIT), implementation of Service Desk and ITSM tooling. (70%) 
■ Key customers: 
– Minimarkets "Да!" / LLC "Fresh market" 
– Redmond / LLC "Technopoisk" 
– UESHKA / LLC "Classcard" 
– Yota / LLC "Скартел" 
– PJSC "Power Machines" 
 
■ Achievements: 
– complex ITSM projects for "Fresh market" and "Power Machines". Automation of a set of processes: Incident Mngt, Request Fulfillment, Problem Mngt, Change Mngt, Asset and Configuration Mngt, Service Level Mngt, Catalog Mngt, Availability Mngt, Capacity Mngt. 
– pretty economic effective project for "Redmond". Implementing of 5 main service processes with full automation at least 5-6 times cheaper than proposes large IT integrators companies. 
 
2. Conducting a corporate classes, teaching ITIL v2/v3, business process modeling notations like ARIS and BPMN. (20%) 
 
3. Development of personal brand: blogging, personal site contenting, webinars, etc (10%) 
■ Achievements: 
– part-time contracts with leading IT integrators: AT Consulting, Корус Консалтинг, GMCS 
– speeches for leading ITSM's conferences in Russia and CIS: itSM Forum, OSP Con, CRM Days.

1. IT and service process management (40%) 
■ Main activities: 
– Engineering of main IT and service processes: Event Mngt, IncMngt&RF, SLM, Asset&Configuration Mngt, Change Mngt, IT purchasing, On-boarding, corporate equipment accounting, BYOD, etc. 
– implementing a service system based on Terrasoft BPM'Online. 
– development a chain regional sales offices as IT lead 
■ Achievements: 
– establishing "alive" processes and actual IT service catalog for rather turbulent company 
– no any delay in regions launching due to IT issues. 
 
2. Setting up Yota subscriber service in MVNO business model with Megafon PJSC. (40%) 
■ Main activities: 
– conceptual interface development between Yota and MF: abstract, logical and technical layers 
– development of integrated subscriber processes 
– web-API integration of the ITSM systems Yota and Megafon: BPM'Online и HP Service Manager. 
■ Achievements: 
– economic effective project of integration. Despite a symmetrical topology, Yota spent 4 times less money than Megafon. 
 
3. Financial, information security and Due Diligence counter audit escort. (10%) 
 
4. Other non profile tasks, which were a lot in Yota. (10%)

1. Business analytic in a ITSM development team. (60%) 
■ Main activities: 
– requirements gathering and analysis, specification definition 
– setting up a systems installation, scripting 
– quality check of implementing, testing 
– reporting development in the BIRT and Crystal Reports 
■ Achievements: 
– ITIL Expert graduation in the age of 23, youngest in CIS 
– development of internal BI system based on BIRT, Xcelsius, Mondrian OLAP. 
 
2. Project manager of IT outsourcing. Clients were Heineken, P&G Gillette. (30%) 
■ Main activities: 
– negotiation with customers, aim gathering and analysis 
– escalation handling, solving complex cases 
– finance management 
■ Achievements: 
– implementing virtual Service Desk for Heineken 
– annual growth of contracts value 
 
3. Presale activation for ITSM, CRM, BI streams. (10%) 
■ Main activities: 
– conducting a pre-project surveys, requirements specification 
– economic assessment 
– development of PoC, solution presenting
